languageKey.label: Check this item to disable this feed
Disabled feeds are not imported
This is the URL of the ATOM/RSS feed
Enter URL exacly as it is specified on feed's web site
Import interval defines how often feed is imported

Format is similar to PHP strtotime() function. For example, "+1 hour" or "+1 day". Incorectly configured value may prevent feed from being imported. Note that cron job must run with sufficient intervals. If this field is set to "+1 hour" but cron job runs once a day, feeds will be imported only once a day. But if cron job runs every 10 minutes, feed will be imported every one hour.
http://php.net/strtotime
Article expiration interval defines when articles are expired and removed

If this field is set to empty value, no removal will happen. Format is similar to PHP strtotime() function. For example, "+1 hour" or "+1 day". Incorectly configured value may prevent items from being removed. Note that cron job must run with sufficient intervals. If this field is set to "+1 hour" but cron job runs once a day, feeds will be checked for expired articles only once a day. But if cron job runs every 10 minutes, feed will be checked for expired articles every one hour.
This field shows when feed was last imported.
This field shows date and time of the most recent imported article for this feed.
Here importers are configured.
Many importers are supported per single feed. Additional importers can be provided by extensions. Each importer has its own configuration, which should be filled in.
This field shows currently selected importer.
Changing the importer will also change configuration field below.
This field shows configuration for the importer selected above
Importer configuration is specific to each importer.
